DOC.brief_summary: This pilot clinical trial study pain management smartphone application monitoring pain patient locally advanced head neck cancer undergo radiation therapy . The study also open patient esophageal lung cancer . A smartphone application may allow patient assess symptom manner closer real-time recall pain episodes weekly on-treatment visit health care provider . This real-time monitoring may improve time efficacy intervention lead well pain-control quality life .
DOC.brief_title: Pain Management Smartphone Application Patients With Stage III-IV Head Neck Cancer Undergoing Radiation Therapy
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Obtain consumer input determine optimal way address monitor patient 's symptom . II . Train patient use pain management smartphone application ( PMSA ) determine compliance characteristic number additional on-treatment visit ( OTVs ) prompt usage application . OUTLINE : Selected patient interview input help guide word question PMSA . All patients/caregivers instruct download PMSA demonstrate properly use application . Beginning first day radiation therapy ( day 1 ) , patient instruct use PMSA duration radiation therapy ( day 50 ) , although timing may change base availability app .
